page.title: 12Whitworth Rush Cart :2
page.content: Eventually the rushes were not needed in the church but the tradition lived on because it had become a holiday. In the early 1900's the ceremony died out because people had proper holidays and more money. Perhaps the churches were also less draughty! In 1976 the Whitworth Rush Cart Procession was revived. A rush cart dance was remembered by people who were young enough to recall the year of 1920 when celebrations and dances were held to commemorate the newly erected War Memorial. In 1977, the Queen's Silver Jubilee Year, a charter was found that enabled a fair to be held in Whitworth each September and the Whitworth Fair has taken place every year since that date.
